templates.template: Azure Microsoft SQL Database by HTTP
templates.name: Azure Microsoft SQL Database by HTTP
templates.description:
This template is designed to monitor Microsoft SQL databases by HTTP.
It works without any external scripts and uses the script item.

Setup:
  1. Create an Azure service principal via the Azure command-line interface (Azure CLI) for your subscription.
    `az ad sp create-for-rbac --name zabbix --role reader --scope /subscriptions/<subscription_id>`
    See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cli/azure/create-an-azure-service-principal-azure-cli for more details.
  2. Link the template to a host.
  3. Configure the macros: {$AZURE.APP.ID}, {$AZURE.PASSWORD}, {$AZURE.TENANT.ID}, {$AZURE.SUBSCRIPTION.ID}, and {$AZURE.RESOURCE.ID}.

You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/

Generated by official Zabbix template tool "Templator"

items.name: Availability status detailed
items.description: The summary description of the availability status.

items.name: Availability state
items.description: The availability status of the resource.

triggers.expression: last(/Azure Microsoft SQL Database by HTTP/azure.db.mssql.availability.state)=1
triggers.name: Microsoft SQL database is degraded
triggers.description: The resource is in a degraded state.

triggers.expression: last(/Azure Microsoft SQL Database by HTTP/azure.db.mssql.availability.state)=3
triggers.name: Microsoft SQL database is in unknown state

triggers.expression: last(/Azure Microsoft SQL Database by HTTP/azure.db.mssql.availability.state)=2
triggers.name: Microsoft SQL database is unavailable

items.name: Connections failed: System errors
items.description: The count of failed connections with system errors.

items.name: Connections successful
items.description: The count of successful connections.

items.name: CPU limit
items.description: The CPU limit. Applies to the vCore-based databases.

items.name: Percentage CPU
items.description: The CPU percent of a host.

triggers.name: High CPU utilization
triggers.description: The CPU utilization is too high. The system might be slow to respond.

items.name: CPU used
items.description: The CPU used. Applies to the vCore-based databases.

items.name: Get errors
items.description: A list of errors from API requests.

triggers.expression: length(last(/Azure Microsoft SQL Database by HTTP/azure.db.mssql.data.errors))>0
triggers.name: There are errors in requests to API
triggers.description: Zabbix has received errors in response to API requests.

items.name: Get data
items.description: The result of API requests is expressed in the JSON.

items.name: Data IO percentage
items.description: The percentage of physical data read.

items.name: Deadlocks
items.description: The count of deadlocks. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

items.name: Connections blocked by firewall
items.description: The count of connections blocked by firewall.

items.name: Log IO percentage
items.description: The percentage of I/O log. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

items.name: SQL Server process core percent
items.description: The CPU usage as a percentage of the SQL DB process. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

items.name: SQL Server process memory percent
items.description: Memory usage as a percentage of the SQL DB process. Not applicable to data warehouses.

items.name: Sessions count
items.description: The number of active sessions. Not applicable to Synapse DW Analytics.

items.name: Sessions percentage
items.description: The percentage of sessions. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

items.name: Data space allocated
items.description: The allocated data storage. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

items.name: Differential backup storage size
items.description: Cumulative differential backup storage size. Applies to the vCore-based databases. Not applicable to the Hyperscale databases.

items.name: Log backup storage size
items.description: Cumulative log backup storage size. Applies to the vCore-based and Hyperscale databases.

items.name: Full backup storage size
items.description: Cumulative full backup storage size. Applies to the vCore-based databases. Not applicable to the Hyperscale databases.

items.name: Data space used percent
items.description: Data space used percent. Not applicable to the data warehouses or Hyperscale databases.

triggers.name: Storage space is critically low
triggers.description: Critical utilization of the storage space.

triggers.name: Storage space is low
triggers.description: High utilization of the storage space.

items.name: Data space used
items.description: Data space used. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

items.name: In-Memory OLTP storage percent
items.description: In-Memory OLTP storage percent. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

items.name: Tempdb data file size
items.description: The space used in `tempdb` data files, expressed in bytes. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

items.name: Tempdb log used percent
items.description: The percentage of space used in `tempdb` transaction log file. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

items.name: Tempdb log file size
items.description: The space used in `tempdb` transaction log file, expressed in bytes. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

items.name: Workers percentage
items.description: The percentage of workers. Not applicable to the data warehouses.

macros.description: The App ID of Microsoft Azure.
The critical threshold of CPU utilization, expressed in %.
The critical threshold of memory utilization, expressed in %.
The critical threshold of storage utilization, expressed in %.
The warning threshold of storage utilization, expressed in %.
Sets the HTTP proxy value. If this macro is empty, then no proxy is used.
Microsoft Azure Microsoft SQL database ID.
